intro: Humata falcinella, commonly known as the narrow-leafed humata, is a species of flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are typically clustered in umbels. Humata falcinella is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
